name: Hanna Neumann conjecture
rephrased: The rank (minimum number of generators) of the intersection of any two finitely generated subgroups of a free group is at most the product of their individual ranks minus one.
implication_form: If H and K are finitely generated subgroups of a free group, then the rank of their intersection H âˆ© K is at most (rank(H) * rank(K)) - 1.
solved_by: Joel Friedman and Igor Mineyev (2011) proved a strengthened version; a third proof was published in 2017.
